snippet: The board, which was acting on a report from a task force created by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, also heard recommendations for addressing problems at a Rockland County school system.
abstract: New York State's Board of Regents approves four-year moratorium on use of state test scores as component in teacher evaluations; move represents sharp reversal by both state and Gov Andrew E Cuomo, who earlier in 2015 pushed to increase weight of test scores in evaluations.
lead_paragraph: The board, which was acting on a report from a task force created by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, also heard recommendations for addressing problems at a Rockland County school system.

headline.main: New York Regents Vote to Exclude State Tests in Teacher Evaluations
headline.print_headline: State Regents Vote to Exclude Student Test Scores in Teacher Evaluations for 4 Years
